The Browns aren't even a five-win team. They are one dimensional on offense. The defense still has holes against the run. Adding one player to the line doesn't fix the worst run defense in the league. It helps, but it doesn't all of a sudden go from worst against the run to even top 10. This team had the fewest number of touchdowns for a receiving unit last year. They replaced that unit with guys who combined to score LESS touchdowns than that group. The quarterback situation is such a mess that the third-string guy is the best long-term candidate to start. McCown is garbage. He had one good half of a season in his career. Manziel is an idiot. Run all you want. You still have to pass on 50 percent of downs. And smart defensive coordinators will stack the box and force the pass while pressuring the quarterback forcing lots of sacks and turnovers. The line is good, but five guys can't block seven, which means two will run free to the QB. How do you spin that into a legitimate playoff contender? Oh, and don't forget the schedule is more difficult than last year's. Even if the Browns are no worse in ability, which I would argue it is worse, the record goes from 7-9 to 5-11. Last I checked, five wins doesn't get you in playoff contention.

data.name: Cleveland Browns vs. Denver Broncos Game Preview

data.message: This will be a version of last year's Colts game. Browns keep Manning off balance until the fourth quarter, when he leads the Broncos on an 80+ yard drive to win the game with, say, 46 seconds left to play ...

The only way we win this one is outscore or shut out Denver both hard to do.  It will be a game where offensive explosion by the Browns will be necessary most likely. Especially if the Defense is playing less great than expected going into the season. It's time to beat the Broncos the last time they did I was in the Air Force stationed in Denver and actually was at that game at old Mile High Stadium. It was a great feeling as Matt Stover or whoever our kicker was made a game winning field goal to stun a Denver Monday night football crowd! One of the best games I went to if not thee best game i ever attended. I mean Monday night football, national TV audience, game in Denver we had a bad record that year under Bud Carson but pulled off a major upset! I had on my seal brown, Browns starter jacket right in the midst of the bronco faithful in the end zone that had the statue of the bronco horse at the top and the bronco barrel man and painted face guy. I rubbed it in there faces, lifting my hands and shouting YEEEEESSS IN YAWLS FACE! lol they could not believe they lost üòú

data.name: 5 things the Browns must do in order to make the playoffs

data.message: It's not that far out of the question guy if you knew anything about this year's and last year's cleveland Browns, we have arguably a top 10, maybe a top 5 defense, probably top 3 oline and serviceable rbs, that can easily win us 7-9 games as long as our qbs don't screw us over, even in this qb lead league you don't need a great qb to always win, just one that doesn't make a million mistakes

1. Win a game 
2. Win another game 
3. Win more games than they lose 
4. Win more games than the other teams in the conference 
5. Don't lose games 

Those are 5 things the Browns need to do to make the playoffs.

data.name: Browns Mailbag: Why are the Browns in better shape now than they were last year?

data.message: The Browns arguably have the best defense in the division, if Danny Shelton pans out and Phil Taylor stays healthy. I'd like to see the Browns commit to Johnny this year and see if he can be the star we'd hoped he'd be. A 35 year old Josh McCown isn't the future, so why not see what Manziel can do? I honestly believe he's the best option at QB right now and for the future, but the Browns HAVE to commit to his style of play. The same thing happened with Weeden. The Browns tried to change his style of play and he busted out.
CUT MANZIEL AND WE WILL BE BETTER!!

The Browns are better (on paper) at many positions. I like what they did to improve both the OL and the DL. But QB is the big problem. McCown, as many have noted, is not the answer. Manziel may or may not be a NFL QB. If Manziel proves he can play they go 9-7 but miss the playoffs. If he can't they go 5-11 and the Browns will be looking for a QB again in 2016.
False- no QB. Let hometown Hoyer go.

The Browns are far better off this year under Pettine because he is a leader of men and the roster is full of his guys! Beginning with Danny Sheldon who will not allow teams to impose their will on the BRowns! That's what the Browns lacked since being back in the league! Johnny football is coming along to eventually become the starter with the preparation to be sucessful. The o line and running backs will give defenses a hand full and our wide outs are capable of getting open! All coaches are on the same page now! The Browns should be a hand full for any team!

Browns defense is very good the offensive plays were good as  when Hoyer was on the field not manziel or Mccown so with a some more training with Hoyer & the offense line I think we will do better, easier said than done though.
I predict the Browns defense will score more points than the offense and that will not win them very many games.  The Browns will have the first pick in the draft next year.
I dont believe anything about the Browns anymore. It is time they prove it on the field.

Manziel hasn't even proved he can hold a clip board. That may have been the worst pick this organization ever made. We let Hoyer go, who may not have been the answer, but proved he was a capable starter. What's the answer bring in McCown. LOL!!!!! This team will be lucky to win 5 games! I love what they did in the draft this year, but it's what they should've done a year ago.

data.name: How Randy Starks is adding savvy intelligence to the Browns defensive line

data.message: Trent Dilfer won a Super Bowl with a dominant defense, running game, and offensive line. McCown may not be Rogers, Brady, or Manning but he is on Dilfer's level. I am a Browns fan that lives in Chicago and I watched every start for McCown and he ran the Bears offense better than Cutler. When McCown has talent around him and in the right system he will produce. There is a reason the Bears tried signing McCown in the offseason. Tampa Bay's defense was horrible, the offensive line was horrible, and they had no running game. McCown is playing behind arguably the best offensive line in football behind Thomas, Mack, and Bitonio and will be supported by a strong running game with Johnson, Crowell, and West. The Browns defense will finish top 3 in the NFL. The Browns already had the best secondary and a strong group of LBs. Beefing up the defensive line with Starks, Shelton, and Cooper just fixed the only weak spot on the defense. I can't wait to see how many more turnovers the Browns secondary forces being supported by a dominant front 7. The Browns may not win a Super Bowl next season but they are a lot better than what most people think. Go Browns!
You Guys Got A Good Player On And Off The Field...You Will Be Missed Randy ! -Phins Fan
